pullRequest.body:
Let R be a Dedekind domain with field of fractions K. This PR does two things:

1) makes the finite adeles of K/R into a K-algebra

2) turns `finiteAdeleRing` into a type rather than a subring (because it's most definitely an important object of study in its own right, e.g. it needs a topology, and I don't want to end up in the same kind of hell that we had with rings of integers before they were a type).

Note that this is a leaf file which I intend to develop a fair bit more in the near future.

---

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9268165787/job/25496215287)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9268165787/job/25496214554)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9268165787/job/25496215505)

```suggestion
        simpa only [mul_zero] using WithZero.zero_lt_coe _
```
(this is a comment on one of the dependent PRs and was dealt with there)
Why not marking it simp?
Again, possibly simp?
Can you add a bit of doc, either here or at the top of the file (or at both!) with these new additions?
I've added "We give this (finite adele) ring a K-algebra structure". Is this enough?
Why do you want to get rid of the lemma `mem_finiteAdeleRing_iff`?
I've changed `FiniteAdeleRing` from a term to a type, so the lemma no longer makes any sense as it stands, and I couldn't think of what to replace it with.

Probably what I would suggest is to add a
```lean
instance : Coe (FiniteAdeleRing R K) (K_hat R K) where
  coe := fun x â†¦ x.1
```
together with an `ext` lemma saying that two finite adeles are equal iff they are equal as elements of `K_hat`. Adding boilerplate things about zero/one/add/mul, etc... being the same is probably useless as they can be derived immediately by the corresponding statement for the corresponding class. For example,
```lean
lemma coe_zero (x : FiniteAdeleRing R K) (hx : x = (0 : (FiniteAdeleRing R K))) : (x : K_hat R K) =
    0 := by
  exact ZeroMemClass.coe_eq_zero.mpr hx
```
shows that `coe_zero` would be completely useless, I believe.

Beyond this, LGTM!
Coe lemma added!
Thanks, definitely LGTM! IMHO this PR is ready to go.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add API for finite adele rings
